A Client is used to interact with a User#

class SelfBotClient.client.Client(api_version, loop=None, logger=True, request_latency=0.1, ratelimit_additional_cooldown=10, use_threading=False)[source]#

Bases: HTTPClient

  • ratelimit_additional_cooldown (float) –

await ban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The ban_member function is used to ban a member from the guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to ban a user from

  • user_id (int) – int: Specify the user that is to be banned

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

clientresponse object or None

async for ... in ban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The ban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to ban_member function of each client. The response from each client is yielded back to whatever called this function.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild to ban the user from

  • user_ids (list[int]) – list[int]: Store the list of user ids that will be banned

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

A union of none or an asynciterable[clientresponse]

async for ... in create_channel(guild_id, name, channel_type, topic=None, user_limit=None, position=None, nsfw=False)[source]#

The create_channel function creates a channel in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the object itself

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild id of the server you want to create a channel in

  • name (str) – str: Specify the name of the channel

  • channel_type (ChannelType) – ChannelType: Specify what type of channel you want to create

  • topic (str) – str: Set the topic of the channel

  • user_limit (int) – int: Set the maximum number of users allowed in a voice channel

  • position (int) – int: Set the position of the channel in the list

  • nsfw (bool) – bool: Determine whether the channel is nsfw or not

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

async for ... in create_role(guild_id, name, color=None, hoist=False, permissions=None)[source]#

The create_role function creates a role in the specified guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the attributes and methods of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild in which you want to create a role

  • name (str) – str: Set the name of the role

  • color (RGB_COLOR) – RGB_COLOR: Set the color of the role

  • hoist (bool) – bool: Determine whether the role should be displayed separately in the user list

  • permissions (PermissionBuilder) – PermissionBuilder: Set the permissions for the role

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

The delete_channel function deletes a channel from the server.

async for ... in delete_channels(channel_ids)[source]#
The delete_channels function takes a list of channel_ids and deletes them.

It returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects, which can be used to check the status code for each request.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables and methods

  • channel_ids (list[int]) – list[int]: Specify the list of channel ids that will be deleted

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

await delete_role(guild_id, role_id)[source]#

The delete_role function deletes a role from the guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current object

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to delete a role from

  • role_id (int) – int: Specify the role to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

clientresponse object or None

async for ... in delete_roles(guild_id, role_ids)[source]#
The delete_roles function is a coroutine that takes in two arguments:

  1. guild_id - the id of the server to delete roles from

  2. role_ids - a list of ids for each role to be deleted

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that the roles are being deleted from

  • role_ids (list[int]) – list[int]: Specify the roles that are to be deleted

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

await edit_member(guild_id, user_id, nickname=None, add_roles=None, remove_roles=None)[source]#

The edit_member function allows you to edit a member of a guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the object itself

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to edit a member in

  • user_id (int) – int: Specify the user that you want to edit

  • nickname (str) – str: Change the nickname of a user in a guild

  • add_roles (list[int]) – list[int]: Add roles to a user

  • remove_roles (list[int]) – list[int]: Remove roles from a user

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

A clientresponse object or None

await get_bans(guild_id)[source]#

The get_bans function returns a list of banned users in the guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild id of the server you want to get banned users from

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

A clientresponse object or None

async for ... in get_channels(guild_id)[source]#

The get_channels function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects. The function iterates through the users list, calling get_channels on each user object with the given guild_id as its argument. It then yields each response to be used by other functions.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of a class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild id of the channels you want to get

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

await get_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#
The get_member function is used to get a member from the guild.
Parameters:

guild_id (int): The ID of the guild to get the member from. user_id (int): The ID of the user to get as a member.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables and methods

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to get a member from

  • user_id (int) – int: Specify the user id of the member you want to get

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

A clientresponse object or None

async for ... in get_roles(guild_id)[source]#

The get_roles function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and returns an AsyncIterable of ClientResponse objects. The function iterates through the users attribute, which is an array of User objects, and calls the get_roles function on each user object. The get_roles function returns a ClientResponse object for each user.

Parameters:

  • self – Refer to the current instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild id of the server you want to get roles from

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

An asynciterable of clientresponse objects or None

await unban_member(guild_id, user_id)[source]#

The unban_member function unban a user from the guild.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild that you want to unban a member from

  • user_id (int) – int: Specify the user id of the member to unban

Return type:

Optional[ClientResponse]

Returns:

A clientresponse object or None

async for ... in unban_members(guild_id, user_ids)[source]#

The unban_members function is a coroutine that takes in a guild_id and user_ids list. It then iterates through the users list, popping off the first user id from the user_ids list and passing it to unban_member function of each client. If there is no response or if there was an error, it will return None. Otherwise, it will yield back the response.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • guild_id (int) – int: Specify the guild id of the server you want to unban members from

  • user_ids (list[int]) – list[int]: Store the list of user ids to unban

Return type:

Optional[AsyncIterable[ClientResponse]]

Returns:

A union of none or asynciterable[clientresponse]
